description.en: Students are instructed on how to come up with and answer a feasible linguistics research question within corpus linguistics for Finno-Ugric languages. Issues that the course deals with include where to get the necessary data (including the selection of an adequate sample size, collecting spoken language data etc.) and which ethical and legal aspects need to be kept in mind. Technical terminology will also be covered. We will make use of extant corpus linguistic tools (mainly online resources like SketchEngine, but also software like AntConc and ELAN). In addition, the basics of statistical analysis will be introduced.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide students with the basic skills and knowledge necessary for putting together and conducting linguistics research using corpora and language technology for Finno-Ugric languages. The course is, first and foremost, intended for students who have not worked extensively with corpora and data analysis methods before. The course offers a theoretical background and practical skills for working with extant linguistic data, mainly using corpora, and with a focus on both qualitative and quantitative methods. In addition, we will look at extant language technology tools to come to terms with how computers process and struggle with digital data, especially concerning the challenges faced by smaller Finno-Ugric languages.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda üliõpilastele, lingvistilise uurimistöö koostamiseks ja läbiviimiseks vajalikud põhioskused ja teadmised, kasutades soome-ugri keelte korpusi ja keelatehnoloogiaid. Kursus on mõeldud ennekõike üliõpilastele, kes pole varem korpuste ja andmeanalüüsi meetoditega töötanud. Kursus pakub teoreetilist tausta ja praktilisi oskusi olemasolevate keeleandmetega töötamiseks, kasutades peamiselt korpuseid, ning keskendudes nii kvalitatiivsetele kui ka kvantitatiivsetele meetoditele.

description.et:
Active participation in classes
A - active, regular participation in class discussions; regular attendance; thorough, close reading of literature assignments and homework worksheets; insightful, relevant questions and comments in class
B - active, regular participation in class discussions; regular attendance; thorough reading of literature assignments and homework worksheets; relevant questions and comments in class
C - active, somewhat irregular participation in class discussions; somewhat regular attendance; reading of literature assignments and completion of homework worksheets; somewhat relevant questions and comments in class
D - irregular participation in class discussions; irregular attendance; sporadic reading of literature assignments and completion of homework worksheets; occasional questions and comments in class
E -no participation in class discussions; irregular attendance; insufficient reading of literature assignments and completion of homework worksheets; rare or no questions and comments in class

Presentation of a corpus
A - clearly presented, thoroughly researched, critical assessment of an extant corpus
B - clearly presented, somewhat thoroughly researched, somewhat critical assessment of an extant corpus
C - not so clear presentation, partially researched, not especially critical assessment of an extant corpus
D - poorly presented, partially researched, uncritical assessment of an extant corpus
E - poorly presented, insufficiently researched, uncritical assessment of an extant corpus

Research paper using corpus linguistic methods
A - clearly presented research question using a relevant (sub)corpus for the topic, relevant and sensible application of corpus linguistic methods; thorough and critical assessment of results; well-written, well-structured preliminary presentation and final paper
B - less clearly presented research question using a relevant (sub)corpus for the topic, fairly relevant and somewhat sensible application of corpus linguistic methods; somewhat thorough and critical assessment of results; fairly well-written, well-structured preliminary presentation and final paper
C - not so clearly presented of a somewhat illogical research question, not using the most relevant (sub)corpus for the topic, not quite accurate application of corpus linguistic methods; assessment of results is acceptable, but missing a critical view, not entirely thought-out; preliminary presentation and final paper lack some structural and qualitative thoroughness
D - poor definition of the research question, not the best choice of a relevant (sub)corpus for the topic, rather inaccurate application of corpus linguistic methods; assessment of results is acceptable, but clearly missing a critical view, not entirely thought-out; preliminary presentation and final paper lack significant structural and qualitative thoroughness
E - unclear, poor definition of the research question, poor choice of a relevant (sub)corpus for the topic, inaccurate application of corpus linguistic methods; assessment of results is inaccurate, illogical, and clearly missing a critical view, poorly thought-out; preliminary presentation and final paper lack significant structural and qualitative thoroughness

grade_preconditions.et: active participation and attendance, completion of the presentation of a corpus are required to submit the final research paper

grade_evaluation.et: The final grade will be determined cumulatively based on the three assessment methods listed above, with active participation counting 25%, the corpus presentation 25%, and the final presentation and paper 50%.

debt_elimination.et: the research paper will be due at the latest 1 week before the end of the semester; the specific date will be announced in class

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
